thread.title: Boston Bruins opening night roster: Zdeno Chara's status still in question
thread.title_full: Boston Bruins opening night roster: Zdeno Chara's status still in question

author: Annie Maroon | gmaroon@masslive.com
title: Boston Bruins opening night roster: Zdeno Chara's status still in question
text:
Comments 
The Boston Bruins' opening night roster is set with 23 players, not counting the injured Zdeno Chara, who did not say on Wednesday whether or not he would play the first game of the season after suffering an upper body injury in the preseason. 
Jonas Gustavsson will back up Tuukka Rask as the No. 2 goalie to start the year, as expected after he signed a one-year, one-way contract with the team on Sunday . Jeremy Smith was assigned to the Iowa Wild of the AHL on Tuesday. 
Other than that, one of the bigger surprises on the list is forward Tyler Randell, who worked his way into the Bruins' bottom-six conversation with a good training camp. 
Randell, 24, had 11 goals and nine assists last year for the Providence Bruins, his fourth year with Providence. He also showed his willingness to fight in the preseason, dropping the gloves three times in four games, and fought 14 times in the AHL last year. 
With Chara's status in question, the Bruins have seven other defensemen on the roster, as well as 14 forwards and two goaltenders. 
If Chara does return to the lineup, Colin Miller could be the odd man out on defense. You can see the full roster in the gallery above.
